Description: Fragment from shoulder of pottery closed vessel. Interior, reserved. Exterior, two registers of animals. The first contains a goat(?) looking backwards, the second a swan and a sphinx confronted. All are in black with added red and incised detail and both registers contain filling motifs and dot rosettes. Execrable drawing.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 224, no. 111)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 109, pl. XXXIV, no. 320.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.311)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4806 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
